analyzed: ngas ni byang chub thob gyur te //

analyzed: chung ma la yang ma bltas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni byang chub phyir //
translated: “For the sake of the Buddha’s enlightenment,

analyzed: bdag gi sha yang bskam par bgyi //

original: khyim kun kyang ni spang bar bgyi //
analyzed: khyim kun kyang ni spang bar bgyi //

original: dgon par mchis nas 'gum par bgyi //
analyzed: dgon par mchis nas 'gum par bgyi //

original: srog chags kun la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: srog chags kun la phan pa'i phyir //

original: khyim med par ni rab byung nas //
analyzed: khyim med par ni rab byung nas //

original: dgon pa rab dgon sten bgyid cing //

analyzed: smra ba sdig pa yi //

original: 'dod pa'i phyir yang mi sten te //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir yang mi sten te //

original: de la gnas par gyur bas na //
analyzed: de la gnas par gyur bas na //

analyzed: bdag ni rgyab kyis phyogs bar gyur //

analyzed: deng nyid bdag ni rab tu 'byung //

original: gang du bdag ni 'dod la zhugs gyur pas //

original: rgyal ba'i bstan la ched du rab byung la //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bstan la ched du rab byung la //
translated: I will go forth in the Victor’s teachings,

original: byang chub mchog phyir brtson 'grus brtsam par bgyi //
analyzed: byang chub mchog phyir brtson 'grus brtsam par bgyi //

analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams kyi zhe sdang gi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed do //

analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams kyi gti mug gi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed do //

analyzed: gti mug gi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed do // sems can @267a *//

analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed do //

translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, having stabilized the dharmakāya, having blessed himself to become the medicine of the Dharma, pacifies the burning of desire of many sentient beings, up to pacifying the burning of desire of inexpressibly inexpressible sentient beings.🔽He pacifies the burning of anger.

analyzed: gti mug gi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed do //

original: rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Śāriputra, just as the blessed, thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Dīpaṃkara prophesied to me, ‘Young man, in the future, after countless eons, you will become the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Śākyamuni,’

analyzed: lus rul pa dang / lba ba dang / 'bras dang / me dbal dang / g-yan pa dang / rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyis rgyas par gyur to //

analyzed: de na sman pa brgya stong phrag mang po sems can de dag gi nad rab tu zhi bar bya ba la brtson par byed do //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: lha dag dang ni klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin dri za srin po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa dang / bdag cag nas las thar byed gang /

analyzed: byas pa bdag kyang gzo bar bya //// bam po bco lnga pa /

analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu / ngas mi'i las 'das pa'i @268a *//
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

analyzed: mi'i las 'das pa lha'i rna ba rnam par dag pas sems can de dag gi sgra cher phyung ba thos te /

analyzed: mthong zhing thos nas sems can de dag la snying rje chen po skyes te /

original: de dag la ngas 'di snyam du bsam mo //🔽nga sems can 'di dag gi gnas su gyur cig /
analyzed: de dag la ngas 'di snyam du bsam mo // nga sems can 'di dag gi gnas su gyur cig /

translated: May I become a life-raft for those beings who have no life-raft.🔽May I become a life-line for those beings who have no life-line.🔽May I become a life-rope for those beings who have no life-rope.🔽May I become a life-cord for those beings who have no life-cord.🔽May I become a life-rope for those beings who have no life-rope.🔽May I become a life-cord for those beings who have no life-cord.🔽May I become a life-cord for those beings who have no life-cord.🔽May I become a life-cord for those beings who have no life-cord.🔽May I become a life-cord for those beings who have no life-cord.

original: sems can gso ba med pa rnams kyi gso ba sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gso ba med pa rnams kyi gso ba sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: May I become a life-cord for those beings who have no life-cord.

original: snyam ste / sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: snyam ste / sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: May I become a life-cord

translated: I made the body of Śakra disappear and was reborn as an animal called Dṛḍha, not far from the great city of Kuru. I lived in the sky above,

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo'i tshogs thams cad la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bskul to //
translated: and I encouraged all the people of Jambudvīpa with these verses:

translated: there is an animal called Dṛḍha.

analyzed: gang dag de yi sha la yongs za ba //

analyzed: de kun nad las yongs su thar par 'gyur //

original: 'jigs shing skrag pa dag par tu ma byed par //
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag pa dag par tu ma byed par //
translated: Do not be afraid or terrified!

original: de yi sha ni ji ltar 'dod dag longs //
analyzed: de yi sha ni ji ltar 'dod dag longs //
translated: Take his flesh as you wish.

original: @268b de ni gnod par mi sems khro gshe med //
analyzed: @268b de ni gnod par mi sems khro gshe med //
translated: He does not think of harming you, nor is he angry.

original: de ni dzambu'i gling gi rtsi yin no //
analyzed: de ni dzambu'i gling gi rtsi yin no //
translated: He is the medicine for Jambudvīpa.”

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: grong khyer chen po brgyad khri bzhi stong phrag bzhi po de dag dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / tshong 'dus dang / ri khrod stong pa de dag na sems can na ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyis sgra de thos nas grong khyer chen po ku ru zhes bya ba ga la ba dang /
analyzed: grong khyer chen po brgyad khri bzhi stong phrag bzhi po de dag dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / tshong 'dus dang / ri khrod stong pa de dag na sems can na ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyis sgra de thos nas grong khyer chen po ku ru zhes bya ba ga la ba dang /
translated: In those eighty-four thousand great cities, and in the villages, towns, markets, and empty valleys, all the sick beings who heard that sound went to the great city of Kuru

original: srog chags kyi rnam pa des pa gang na yod pa der song ste phyin nas srog chags des pa zhes bya ba'i lus las sha bcad cing bcad cing khyer yang de'i lus las sha yongs su zad par ma gyur te /

translated: and to the place where the being named Dṛḍha was. When they arrived, they cut off and took flesh from the being named Dṛḍha’s body, but his body’s flesh was never exhausted.

analyzed: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di byung ngo //
translated: At that time, this verse appeared:🔽“If my words are true,

analyzed: gang phyir bden pas byang chub reg 'gyur zhing //
translated: and I will reach awakening through truth,

analyzed: ye shes phung po de zad mi 'gyur te // nga yi tshig de bden par 'gyur zhe na //

analyzed: lus la sha ni nam yang zad ma gyur //
translated: then let the flesh on my body never be exhausted.”

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

analyzed: dzam bu'i gling kun gyi skye bo'i tshogs thams cad kyis des pa zhes bya ba'i srog chags kyis sha bcad cing bcad cing khyer yang de'i lus la bri ba'am gang bar yang mi mngon te /
translated: All the people of Jambudvīpa took the flesh of the being called Dīpaṃkara, and though it was cut and cut again, his body did not appear to diminish or to be depleted.

original: de yang bcad yang bcad kyang slar de bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: de yang bcad yang bcad kyang slar de bzhin du skye'o //
translated: And though it was cut and cut again, it grew back as before.

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: gang sems can na ba rnams kyis des pa zhes bya ba'i srog chags kyi sha zos na /
analyzed: gang sems can na ba rnams kyis des pa zhes bya ba'i srog chags kyi sha zos na /
translated: when sentient beings who were sick ate the flesh of the being called Dīpaṃkara,

analyzed: de dag gi nad thams cad byang ste nad med cing bde ba las mi 'gyur bar gyur to //
translated: all their illnesses were cured, and they were happy and well, and did not revert to being sick.

analyzed: de bzhin du mthar gyis dzambu'i gling na na ba thams cad kyi nad sna tshogs byang ste nad med par byas nas bde zhing 'gyur ba med do // de nas dzambu'i @269a *//
translated: In the same way, gradually all the various illnesses of all the sick people in Jambudvīpa were cured, and they were made well, happy, and free from illness.

analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis rang gi lus kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su shes te /

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis kyang 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gal bar mi byed /

analyzed: 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis kyang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid 'gal bar mi byad de /
translated: The suchness of the present does not contradict the suchness of the past.🔽The suchness of the past does not contradict the suchness of the present.

original: yang 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yang 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the suchness of the past, the suchness of the future, and the suchness of the present are the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.🔽

analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid /

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i de bzhin nyid do //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i de bzhin nyid do //

analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa'i de bzhin nyid do //

analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'du byed thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de nyid yin te; yang sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni / de kho na'o //

translated: the king of physicians, Jivaka, who knows how to cure the illnesses of the world, does not have that knowledge of medicine.🔽Śāriputra,

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi skus che ba yang 'di lta ste /

translated: As soon as they touch him, all the sicknesses of those beings are cured and they are freed from all pain, because of the Bodhisattva’s pure aspiration in the past.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

translated: the body of a bodhisattva who has a Dharma body

analyzed: zas kham gyi za bas lus gso ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: de kha zas thams cad yongs su shes pas sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba'i phyir zas za'o //

analyzed: de zas za yang gtong bar mi byed do //

analyzed: zas za yang lus kyi nang du gtong bar mi byed do //

original: yongs su mi nyams so //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams so //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi lus can la tshe dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba yang med la /
translated: a bodhisattva who has a Dharma body does not have a life span, death, or rebirth.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang ston to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang ston to //
translated: He manifests death and rebirth in order to ripen beings.

analyzed: de 'chi 'pho yang chos thams cad 'chi 'pho med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that death is the non-death of all things, and that it is not a product.

original: skye yang chos thams cad 'pho ba med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: skye yang chos thams cad 'pho ba med par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that rebirth is the non-transmigration of all things.

original: 'byung yang chos thams cad skye ba med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'byung yang chos thams cad skye ba med par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that appearance is the non-arising of all things.

translated: He ripens beings by means of the body of truth, the food of truth, the strength of truth, and the reliance on truth, through the spontaneous accomplishment of his former vows, and without losing his enthusiasm, he practices the perfection of enthusiasm.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Lord, in order to teach this very topic, recited these verses:

original: de dag lus ni rdo rje @274a *//
analyzed: de dag lus ni rdo rje @274a *//
translated: Their bodies are like vajra,

original: lta bur mi shigs pa //
analyzed: lta bur mi shigs pa //
translated: And like a diamond, it is indestructible.

original: 'dul ba'i dus shes nas ni tha dad ston par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i dus shes nas ni tha dad ston par 'gyur //
translated: Knowing the time for taming, he manifests separately.

analyzed: mtshon gyis mi tshugs mes ni tshig pa ma yin yang // 'dul ba'i sems can mthong na tshugs shing mes tshig 'gyur //
translated: He is not harmed by weapons or burned by fire,🔽But when he sees beings to be tamed, he is harmed and burned by fire.

original: sems can na ba mthong na sman rnams su yang 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can na ba mthong na sman rnams su yang 'gyur //
translated: When he sees sick beings, he becomes medicine.

original: de bzhin bkres pa rnams la zas dang skom du 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin bkres pa rnams la zas dang skom du 'gyur //
translated: Likewise, for the hungry, he becomes food and drink.

original: 'on kyang chos kyi dbyings la rnam rtog ci yang med //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos kyi dbyings la rnam rtog ci yang med //
translated: Yet the realm of phenomena has no conceptualization whatsoever.

original: chos kyi sku dang lus med tshul gcig rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang lus med tshul gcig rab tu 'jug /
translated: The dharma body and the way of being without a body are completely engaged.

original: shed las skyes dang gso dang shed can yod min te //
analyzed: shed las skyes dang gso dang shed can yod min te //
translated: There is no Manu, no Nourisher, and no Manu-possessor.

original: chos so cog ni rten cing 'brel te byung bar shes //
analyzed: chos so cog ni rten cing 'brel te byung bar shes //
translated: All phenomena are known to arise in dependence.

original: gang de'i skyon yod pa na sdug bsngal lam 'byung ste //
analyzed: gang de'i skyon yod pa na sdug bsngal lam 'byung ste //
translated: When there is the presence of that fault, the path of suffering arises.

original: rkyen med pa na sdug bsngal lam ni chad par 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen med pa na sdug bsngal lam ni chad par 'gyur //
translated: When there are no conditions, the path of suffering is cut off.

original: gzugs ni lbu ba rdos pa 'dra ste snying po med //

analyzed: de rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba yang rjes su dran no /

analyzed: @291b gzhan dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu yang rjes su dran no //

analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang sems can rnams rjes su dran par byas nas byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
translated: He recollects the roots of virtue of other sentient beings, and causes them to generate the Awakening Mind.

translated: He teaches that the causes of past happiness and suffering are impermanent, painful, empty, and without self.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin /

original: brgya byin 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin /

analyzed: tshangs pa 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin 'jig rten skyong ba 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin /
translated: not arrogant about their desire for Brahmā, not arrogant about their desire for the guardians of the world,

original: skye ba thams cad 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad 'dod pas dregs pa ma yin /
translated: not arrogant about their desire for all births,

original: 'dod pa dang / rgyal po'i srid dang / dbang phyug gi bde ba thams cad 'dod pa'i blo gros can ma yin te /🔽gzhan du na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du srid pa 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / rgyal po'i srid dang / dbang phyug gi bde ba thams cad 'dod pa'i blo gros can ma yin te / gzhan du na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du srid pa 'dzin pa ni /
translated: not arrogant about their desire for all the pleasures of desire, kingship, and power.🔽They do not have the intention to desire any of that,🔽except for the sake of bringing sentient beings to maturity,

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: for which they intentionally take on existence.

original: de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la rton pas sngon gyi nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa la khrel zhing ngo tsha bar byed /

translated: Since they rely on impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self, they are ashamed of and embarrassed by their previous afflictive actions.

original: smod par byed de /🔽da ltar byung ba'i dngos pos srog gi phyir yang mi dge ba'i rtsa bar @292a *//
analyzed: smod par byed de / da ltar byung ba'i dngos pos srog gi phyir yang mi dge ba'i rtsa bar @292a *//
translated: They disparage them.

original: 'gyur ba'i las mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i las mi byed do //
translated: They do not commit any unwholesome actions for the sake of their lives in the present.🔽They dedicate their previous roots of virtue to unsurpassed and perfect awakening, and they increase them.

original: de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing rgyas par byed do; ;da ltar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i yongs su bsngo ba spangs
analyzed: de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing rgyas par byed do; ;da ltar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i yongs su bsngo ba spangs
translated: They do not dedicate their present roots of virtue in a way that is incompatible with the universal dedication.

original: te / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos kyi rigs dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir dran pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen par yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: te / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos kyi rigs dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir dran pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen par yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: He generates the power of right mindfulness in order to make the lineage of the Buddha, the lineage of the Dharma, and the lineage of the Saṅgha continue uninterrupted.

original: de'i dran pa de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dran pa de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: His mindfulness is well empowered by the empowerment of the realm of phenomena.

original: shin tu rigs pas mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: shin tu rigs pas mi g-yo'o //
translated: It is unshakable by reason.

original: bsam gtan yongs su sbyang ba byas pas ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan yongs su sbyang ba byas pas ma brtags pa'o //
translated: It is not fabricated by the purification of meditation.

original: zhi gnas kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pas gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pas gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not harmful by the empowerment of tranquility.

original: lhag mthong gis shin tu yang dag par zin pas 'khrul pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis shin tu yang dag par zin pas 'khrul pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not deluded by the right grasp of insight.

original: mngon sum gyi phyir phal pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi phyir phal pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not ordinary because it is direct.

original: dran pa ma nyams pa'i phyir brjed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ma nyams pa'i phyir brjed pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not forgetful because it is not lost.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa dang / gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir myong ba chen po'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa dang / gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir myong ba chen po'o //
translated: It is a great experience because it is the accumulation of a great mass of merit and the accumulation of the mass of knowledge that does not depend on others.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir pha rol tu song ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir pha rol tu song ba ste /
translated: It is the going beyond because it is the accumulation of the mass of all the perfections.

original: de ltar dran pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams brjed pa med @292b pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa yang dag par bskyed pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams brjed pa med @292b pa 'di ni /
translated: In this way, the power of the generation of correct mindfulness is the non-forgetting of past and present phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi las yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi las yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This is the completion of the bodhisattva’s knowledge of the superknowledge of the knowledge of former existences.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pas mngon par shes pa ni /🔽gang / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi las yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pas mngon par shes pa ni / gang / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi las yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
translated: what is the bodhisattva’s superknowledge that is the knowledge of the performance of miracles?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is the completion of the activity of the knowledge of the superknowledge?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dun pa ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dun pa ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom pa ste /
translated: and he cultivates the foot of miraculous power that is accompanied by the volition of vigour, the volition of mind and the volition of investigation.

original: de 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pas rab tu zin pa'i chos rnams 'dod pa dang / stug par byed pa dang / dbang sgyur ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'di dag shin tu yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul rnams mngon du thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pas rab tu zin pa'i chos rnams 'dod pa dang / stug par byed pa dang / dbang sgyur ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'di dag shin tu yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul rnams mngon du thob pa yin te /
translated: He is one who has attained the superknowledges because he has well cultivated these four feet of miraculous power which are accompanied by aspiration, vigour, mind and investigation, and which are the basis for the attainment of the desired, the dense and the mastery.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi spang ba rnam pa du ma myong ngo //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi spang ba rnam pa du ma myong ngo //
translated: He experiences the various kinds of miraculous transformations through the miraculous power of transformation.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dag kyang sems can la blta ba'i phyir yongs su goms pa yin no //🔽de gzugs sam /

analyzed: de bas na /

analyzed: de grol bzhin du skye /

analyzed: grol bzhin du 'chi 'pho //

analyzed: mtshan ma med /

analyzed: dbyibs med do //

original: gang kha dog med /
analyzed: gang kha dog med /

original: mtshan ma med /
analyzed: mtshan ma med /

analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su gtogs pa dang / gtogs pa zhes bya zhe na /

translated: Because not even an atom’s worth of a phenomenon that is a basis or a basis for a basis can be apprehended, therefore it is called a basis and a basis for a basis.

analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang zhe na /

translated: It is love and the absence of self, compassion and the absence of sentient beings, joy and the absence of life force, impartiality and the absence of persons, generosity and the mind of generosity,

analyzed: tshul khrims dang zhi ba'i sems nyid dang / bzod pa dang mi zad pa'i sems nyid dang / brtson 'grus dang dben pa'i sems nyid dang / bsam gtan dang nges par rtogs pa'i sems nyid dang / shes rab dang spros pa med pa'i sems nyid dang /
translated: discipline and the mind of peace, patience and the mind of inexhaustibility, diligence and the mind of solitude, concentration and the mind of ascertainment, insight and the mind of nonelaboration,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang dran pa med cing @300a *//
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang dran pa med cing @300a *//

analyzed: yid la byed pa med pa'i sems nyid dang / yang dag par spong ba dang skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i sems nyid dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang spros pa med pa'i sems nyid dang / dad pa dang chags pa med pa'i sems nyid dang /
translated: the mind that is free from mental engagement, the mind that is free from arising and ceasing, the mind that is free from elaborations, the mind that is free from attachment,

analyzed: dran pa dang rang byung gi sems nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems nyid dang / shes rab dang dbang po med pa'i sems nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sems nyid dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang byang chub rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: the mind that is self-arisen, the mind that is absorbed in meditative concentration, the mind that is free from faculties, the mind that is free from negativity, the mind that is free from the divisions of the branches of awakening and awakening,

original: lam sgom pa dang sgom pa'i sems nyid dang / zhi gnas dang nye bar zhi ba'i sems nyid dang / lhag mthong dang mthong ba bri ba med pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa sgom pa dang shin tu yongs su shes pa'i sems nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang thog ma nas dag pa nyid dang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i sems nyid dang /

translated: It is the mind of meditation and the path, the mind of calm abiding and complete peace, the mind of insight and the absence of a decrease in vision, the mind of complete understanding of the meditation on the noble truths, the mind of the retention of the sacred Dharma and the indivisibility of the realm of phenomena,

original: mi skye ba la bzod pa dang mi dmigs pa'i sems nyid dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa dang phyir mi ldog pa'i sems nyid dang / mtshan rnyed pa dang mtshan med pa'i sems nyid dang / byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan dang khams gsum gyi snying po'i sems nyid dang /

translated: the mind of acceptance of the unborn and the absence of observation, the mind of the irreversible level and irreversibility, the mind of the attainment of the marks and the absence of marks, and the mind of the adornment of the seat of awakening and the essence of the three realms.

original: bdud tshar gcod pa dang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sems nyid dang / byang chub dang chos thams cad kyi rang @300b bzhin rjes su rtog pa'i sems nyid dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang ldog pa med pa'i sems nyid dang /
analyzed: bdud tshar gcod pa dang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sems nyid dang / byang chub dang chos thams cad kyi rang @300b bzhin rjes su rtog pa'i sems nyid dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang ldog pa med pa'i sems nyid dang /
translated: the mind that defeats Māra and benefits all sentient beings, the mind that realizes the nature of awakening and all phenomena, the mind that turns the wheel of Dharma and never turns back,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston pa'i sems nyid dang / 'khor ba'i rang bzhin mnyam pa'i sems nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston pa'i sems nyid dang / 'khor ba'i rang bzhin mnyam pa'i sems nyid de /
translated: the mind that displays great parinirvāṇa, and the mind that is the same as the nature of saṃsāra.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in this way,

analyzed: rjes su gtogs pa dang / gtogs pa'i don la snyoms par zhugs pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos ni /

analyzed: 'di dag dang / gzhan dag ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa de dag de 'dra zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the amazing and marvelous Dharma of the holy person.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de la bsam gtan zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: what is called concentration?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir de la ma chags pa'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni /
translated: The meditative absorption of the bodhisattvas

original: bdag bde ba la ma chags pa'i phyir myong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag bde ba la ma chags pa'i phyir myong ba med pa'o //
